body:
If you want AFL Picks every week, for free, from a profitable sports bettor, you have to bookmark this page. 

The big guy is is 16 from 29 so far. He had a cold week nine (we're halfway through round 10 at time of publishing), but we're ok with that. His 20%+ ROI was unsustainable and we anticipate him finishing the season in the 7-15% range. Which would mirror his 13% last year.

Fresh from Australia, our expert (who works at a sportsbook in Australia) has been winning on Aussie Rules for a decade.

Each week he shares his best three bets at the spread. Get them early as the line almost always moves in his favor.

- - -

## **AFL Picks Round 12**

## **Geelong vs Port Adelaide**

Geelong are always a good bet as an underdog, so they look an outstanding play here.

The Cats cover at 59% when an outsider and have covered 10 of their last 15. As an interstate underdog, Geelong cover at 71%. 

The Cats have won 8 of their last 10 against Port and can continue that strong run this week. 

### **Recommended Bet:**

Geelong +4.5

- - -

## Western Bulldogs v Adelaide

The Crows are an absolute mess at present. They are winless in 11 games. They have covered the start just once this year. They have not broken 60 points since Round 1. They have conceded 129 more points than the next worst defensive side. 

The Bulldogs have lost their last three but they were against the top two teams and the defending premiers. This could get ugly. 

## **Recommended Bet:**

Western Bulldogs -34.5

- - -

## **West Coast v Hawthorn**

This is a magnificent spot for West Coast, who have a remarkable record as a big favorite in Perth. The Eagles cover at 63% when favored by more than two goals and 69% when favored by more than four goals. 

The Hawks have just a single win in their last six and were exceptionally poor against Freo. 

## **Recommended Bet:**

West Coast -27.5

- - -
